channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 27
item.description:
April 27, 2020 7:40 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, April 27.

item.title: Singaporean man charged with spreading fake news on Covid-19 circuit breaker measures
item.description:
April 27, 2020 7:36 AM

SINGAPORE - A 40-year-old Singaporean has been charged in court after he allegedly posted false information about the Covid-19 circuit breaker measures.

item.title: No corruption in halal certification process: Muis
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis) has rebutted allegations by a foreign news site that its halal certification process is corrupt, saying that it places utmost priority in ensuring the integrity of its system.

item.title: New fund to help SIT students hit by outbreak
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

At least 250 Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) students facing unexpected financial hardship due to the Covid-19 outbreak will get help from a new fund.

item.title: Planning to get hitched? Couples may have marriage solemnised virtually soon
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Couples whose plans to tie the knot were undone by the coronavirus will not have to postpone their nuptials after all, if an upcoming Bill is passed by Parliament to allow them to say their vows remotely.

item.title: Two foreign workers on motorcycle die in accident with car
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Two foreign workers were killed in an accident involving a car and the motorcycle they were on in the early hours of Saturday morning.

item.title: Presentation tips in free livestreamed ST Masterclass
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Being nervous in front of an audience can be a good thing, business presentation coach Steve Dawson said in a free Straits Times (ST) Masterclass livestreamed last Thursday. It keeps the presenter focused and prevents complacency from settling in.

item.title: SMRT buses modified to transport patients safely
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Twenty buses have been retrofitted so that Covid-19 patients can be transported safely between dormitories and hospitals or community care facilities.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore billionaire giving restaurant-quality meals to needy
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Food firm TiffinLabs, co-founded by one of Singapore's youngest billionaires Kishin R.K., has set up a charitable foundation to give free meals to the needy during the Covid-19 crisis.

item.title: Back in Singapore, but working across time zones
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Financial analyst Maegan Wang is among a group of Singaporeans based overseas for their jobs who have chosen to return here due to concerns about the coronavirus situation in their foreign postings.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some companies bucking trend and looking to hire now
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Checks show recent vacancies at public service organisations, banks, product and clothing retailers and real estate companies.

item.title: Rising above adversity to become a maths whizz and top student
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

With a grade point average (GPA) of 3.9 out of 4, Singapore Polytechnic (SP) graduate Amrita Kaur Ishwar Singh is on her way to reading accountancy in university.

item.title: Tax obligations for returning Singaporeans and foreigners
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

For Singaporeans or Singapore permanent residents returning from working abroad: Employment income for the period from the arrival in Singapore to Sept 30 will not be taxable here if:

item.title: Coronavirus: Exhibition centre now an isolation facility, with robots serving meals
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The Changi Exhibition Centre, home of the Singapore Airshow, received its first batch of Covid-19 patients on Saturday.

item.title: Physical setback spurred her interest in pharmacy
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

At age five, Ms Vernice Vee took up taekwondo, and then pursued the martial art for years, but a serious injury brought it to an abrupt end.

item.title: Briton deported over falsely declaring travel history
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A British national, who is married to a Singapore permanent resident, has been deported after he falsely declared his travel history at the Family Justice Courts.

item.title: Polytechnic graduation: Not the usual ceremony but it still goes with a bang
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

About 26,000 polytechnic graduates may leave school this year without the pride and splendour of a graduation ceremony, but they will be an unforgettable cohort.

item.title: Virtual job interviews, training set to be new norm amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

In the middle of next month, Mrs L. Lim, 28, will start her first day as a communications executive with a media company here, but will be working from home.

item.title: Pushing on to succeed, unfazed by rare disease
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

In a span of just two weeks in January 2018, Ms Pearlyn Tan went from running what she thought was a regular fever to being paralysed in the face and from the waist down.

item.title: Coronavirus: Activity kits, exercise videos rolled out for adults with special needs
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

With the circuit breaker measures in place, Ms Ng Jie Qi, who has intellectual disability, is unable to meet her friends from the Touch Centre for Independent Living (TCIL).

item.title: Student who aced exams believes in paying it forward
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

She scored three points in her O-level exams and could have gotten into almost any school she wanted.

item.title: Two returning Singaporeans among 931 new cases
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of new Covid-19 cases in Singapore has gone up again to nearly 1,000, reversing the downward trend over the past few days.

item.title: Public healthcare institutions waive delivery fees for prescription meds
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Public healthcare institutions are waiving delivery fees for patients on prescription medication, as more stay at home amid the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: A tough ride in pursuit of passion for sciences
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Ihsan Ridzwan Azman thought he would not make it to a polytechnic after scoring 27 points in his O-level preliminary exams in 2016 as a Secondary 5 student at Naval Base Secondary School.

item.title: Changi facility ready for Covid-19 patients in less than a month
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The Changi Exhibition Centre has been converted into a community isolation facility in less than a month. It began receiving its first Covid-19 patients with mild symptoms on Saturday.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to work and manage kids at home at same time
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

About two weeks into home-based learning, families have been adapting to new routines brought about by the coronavirus pandemic, managing their children and finding ways to work from home at the same time.

item.title: PM Lee to deliver May Day message at virtual rally
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The May Day Rally will be held virtually for the first time, in the light of the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Sustained fall in numbers needed to be sure virus has been stopped
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

It will take at least a week of sustained decline in local community cases before Singapore can say that it has turned the corner, say infectious diseases experts.

item.title: Firms advised to check in on employees working from home to ensure well-being
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Employers can check in at least once a week on their employees who are working from home due to safe distancing measures.

item.title: Picture this: Home is where the fun is
Business as usual at Yishun mall despite Covid-19 cluster there
item.description:
April 27, 2020 5:00 AM

It was business as usual yesterday morning at Northpoint City, the first major mall here to be identified as a Covid-19 cluster.
